alert.note: Alert for Annette Island; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Prince of Wales Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 6:16AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...A STORM FORCE LOW FOR MID WEEK... A strong low over the Gulf of Alaska looks to bring a storm force front to the panhandle for the middle of the week. This system will bring increased winds along the outer coast as well as areas along the Dixon Entrance. Wind gusts could range from 40 to 60 mph. While details on the exact wind speeds are still not solidified based to the latest forecast solutions, the forecast guidance continues to show a significant front impacting the area Wednesday morning to Thursday morning. As such, confidence in this system continues to increase as well. Most places look to see their strongest winds during the day and into the evening on Wednesday. The exception to this being the southern panhandle, specifically Prince of Wales Island, which could see high winds through Thursday morning before wind speeds decrease across the area. This is an evolving and changing situation. Stay tuned to the National Weather Service for updates at weather.gov/Juneau.

area.areaDesc: Annette Island; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Prince of Wales Island
